summary: This document is Comcast's response to a federal grand jury subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated August 13, 2019. It provides subscriber information and call detail records for a specific telephone number from July 6, 2019, to August 13, 2019, as part of an investigation.

persons.name: AUSA Roos
persons.context: The federal prosecutor to whom the subpoena response from Comcast is addressed. The subpoena requesting the records was signed by this AUSA.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by an Assistant United States Attorney, requesting subscriber records and call details from Comcast for a specific telephone number.

events.title: Call Detail Record Period
events.description: The period for which call detail records were subpoenaed and provided, showing numerous calls to and from the target phone number.

events.title: Comcast Subpoena Response
events.description: Comcast's Legal Response Center formally responds to the grand jury subpoena, providing the requested subscriber information and call detail records.

locations: United States Attorney's Office, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York (NY) 10007
Comcast Legal Response Center, 1800 Bishops Gate Boulevard, Mount Laurel, NJ 08054
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued on August 13, 2019, for Comcast records related to a specific telephone number.
The subscriber for the target phone number was located in North Plainfield, New Jersey (07060).
The subpoena covered call detail records from July 6, 2019, to August 13, 2019, showing a log of calls made and received.
The response indicates the investigation was active in August 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019.
The document is a standard law enforcement response from a telecommunications provider, showing procedural steps in a federal investigation.
